description.zh-cn: 中国近代作家、出版家、翻译家、诗人及无政府主义者。原名李尧棠，字芾甘。曾任中国作家协会主席、全国政协副主席。其作品被翻译成多国文字，代表作有《家》、《春》、《秋》等。他在文化大革命期间受到迫害，晚年提议建立中国现代文学馆和文化大革命博物馆。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer, publisher, translator, poet, and anarchist. His original name was Li Yaotang, and his courtesy name was Feigan. He served as the chairman of the China Writers Association and a vice chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference. His works have been translated into many languages, with representative works including 'Family', 'Spring', and 'Autumn'. He was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution and in his later years proposed the establishment of the Museum of Modern Chinese Literature and a museum for the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的妻子，原名陈蕴珍。作家，《上海文学》、《收获》编辑，兼事文学翻译。
description.en: Wife of Ba Jin, original name Chen Yunzhen. A writer, editor for 'Shanghai Literature' and 'Harvest', and also a literary translator.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国一场自1966年至1976年发生的政治运动，对中国社会各方面造成了深远影响。
description.en: A political movement in the People's Republic of China from 1966 to 1976, which had a profound impact on all aspects of Chinese society.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党领导的、中国各民族作家自愿结合的专业性人民团体。
description.en: A professional people's organization led by the Communist Party of China, composed of writers of various ethnic groups in China on a voluntary basis.

description.en: The national organization of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, serving as the organizational form of the Chinese People's Patriotic United Front.

description.zh-cn: 位于北京，由巴金提议建立，是中国第一家、也是世界最大的文学博物馆。
description.en: Located in Beijing and proposed by Ba Jin, it is the first and largest literature museum in China and the world.

description.zh-cn: 由巴金提议建立但未能实现的博物馆。

description.zh-cn: 巴金的儿子。1982年毕业于复旦大学中文系，曾任上海市政协文史资料编辑室编辑。
description.en: Son of Ba Jin. Graduated from the Chinese Department of Fudan University in 1982 and worked as an editor at the Shanghai CPPCC Cultural and Historical Data Editing Office.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的女儿，作家，《收获》杂志主编。
description.en: Daughter of Ba Jin, a writer and the chief editor of 'Harvest' magazine.

description.zh-cn: 巴金的弟弟，作家、翻译家、上海文史馆馆员、上海文艺出版社编审。
description.en: Ba Jin's younger brother, a writer, translator, member of the Shanghai Museum of Culture and History, and editor at Shanghai Literature and Art Publishing House.

description.zh-cn: 中国作家，曾任中国作家协会主席，巴金是其继任者。

description.en: Chinese writer who succeeded Ba Jin as the chairman of the China Writers Association.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物。时任中共中央政治局常委、全国政协主席，曾为巴金送别。
description.en: Chinese politician. Then a Standing Committee member of the Politburo of the CPC Central Committee and Chairman of the CPPCC National Committee, he attended Ba Jin's farewell ceremony.

description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Ba Jin was criticized by the 'rebel faction' of the Shanghai Writers Association, confined to a 'cowshed', and singled out for criticism in a People's Daily article.

description.en: In 1919, Ba Jin came into contact with Kropotkin's 'An Appeal to the Young' through 'New Youth' magazine, and became a lifelong believer in anarchism.
